desc: Fast Scan (ie. Standard PAL/NTSC) television signals on the amateur bands 70cm and above.
An audio transmission where the signal is modulated by varying the amplitude of the carrier.
A digital mode used to share information such as positions + telemetry, weather,\nmonitored frequencies, alerts etc and for text messaging
Digital Television, generally using the DVB-T and DVB-S worldwide standards on 70cm and above bands.
Used to send still images, short video files or any other file,\nthe files can be encoded directly or used in "Hybrid" mode which sends a URL to fetch.
A popular digital audio mode used mostly through UHF repeaters.
A popular digital audio/data mode used mostly through VHF/UHF repeaters. Supports D-PRS,\nthe D-Star version of APRS when connected to a repeater that supports this feature.
A digital mode using Incremental Frequency keying over a 300Hz bandwidth on 80, 40 and 30 meter bands
An audio transmission where the signal is modulated by varying the frequency of the carrier.

A digital mode using 8-tone AFSK modulation over 50Hz bandwidth, transmitting short, mostly standardized messages\nover a 13 second transmission. A low-signal mode found in WSJT-X. - The most popular digital mode currently.
An analog text mode where the character visuals are encoded as audio.
A digital mode using 65-tone AFSK modulation over 177Hz bandwidth, transmitting short, mostly standardized\nmessages over a 47 second transmission. A low-signal mode found in WSJT-X.
A digital mode using 9-tone AFSK modulation over 15Hz bandwidth, transmitting short, mostly standardized messages\nover a 47 second transmission. A low-signal mode found in WSJT-X.
The original digital mode. Text transmitted as a series of dits and dahs - short and long tones,\neither as a carrier (CW) or as modulated audio.
A digital text mode designed for harsh conditions. Available in a range of baudrates and bandwidths.
A digital text mode designed for harsh conditions. Available in a range of bandwidths and number of tones.
A digital text mode with a variety of speeds and minor variants
A digital mode using mark and space to transmit text. Popular in contests.
An AM audio transmission with one sideband (one half of the AM signal) filtered out,\nand the carrier suppressed. More efficient than AM.
A digital slow scan video mode with error detection and correction. Popular with balloon operators on 70cm.
Used to send still images. Similar to weatherfax transmissions used by government agencies,\nbut in color, and with more cat pictures and bikinis. Quite popular.
A popular digital audio/data mode used mostly through VHF/UHF repeaters.
A digital beacon mode using 4-tone AFSK modulation, transmitting a callsign, grid locator and power output level.\nUsed for propagation testing.
